instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1428  820-3462 Miss bacllight
threads.message:
A1428  820-3462 Miss bacllight
I do have 5V at PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD
PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT - 54V

I just checked this board with another screen and LCD and same. Blinking folder but no backlight.
I also put a working board in this macbook and I can see that screen and lcd cable is ok and works ok.

PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT - 54V as I know this should be 40V (Is what I see in working board) but if it is not screen and lcd cable, what could be?

threads.title: A1428  820-3462 Miss bacllight
threads.message: Look good. You mean I should replaced it?

threads.title: A1428  820-3462 Miss bacllight
threads.message: If everything else checks out fine, then yes

threads.title: A1428  820-3462 Miss bacllight
threads.message: 54V is way too high and usually points to an open line to the LCD. Insert a separate LCD cable and see if pin one has contact to the other side of the cable.

threads.title: A1428  820-3462 Miss bacllight
threads.message:
All ready change lvds connector and lost 54V.... then I replaced again lvds connector with 2010 models. (Board is 2012 model)
It is different but now it works ok. Should be that a problem? I mean to put 2010 lvds to 2012 board? I dont have more 2012 in stock.

threads.title: A1428  820-3462 Miss bacllight
threads.message: Replace with proper connector! You can salvage these connectors from 3115 boards, cracked macbook Air/Retina LCDs.

threads.title: A1428  820-3462 Miss bacllight
threads.message:
Macbook pro 13 only 2 types lvds, right?
2008-2011
2012-2016
